books.title: The Prime Minister
books.author: Anthony Trollope
books.summary: A duke leads a coalition government while doubting his capacity to do so.

books.title: The Mind of Mr. J. G. Reeder
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A meek and unassuming employee at the Department of Public Prosecutions exercises his remarkable skills to solve puzzling crimes.

books.title: Memoirs of a Foxhunting Man
books.author: Siegfried Sassoon
books.summary: A young boy comes of age in the idyllic English countryside just before the Great War tears Europe apart.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: Alice’s Adventures in Wonderland
books.author: Lewis Carroll
books.summary: A young girl follows a white rabbit into a strange land of poetry, humor, and whimsy.

books.title: Something New
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Two young writers experience romance and adventure in Lord Emsworth’s Blandings Castle.

books.title: Hamlet
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: The ghost of the King of Denmark tells his son, Hamlet, to avenge his death.

books.title: The Road to Oz
books.author: L. Frank Baum
books.summary: A young girl takes a passerby down the road near her farm when they find themselves transported to another land.

books.title: The First Sir Percy
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A man and his followers try again to overthrow the Stadtholder of the Netherlands.

books.title: The Dark Other
books.author: Stanley G. Weinbaum
books.summary: A young woman seeks the reason behind her lover’s outbursts of cruelty.

books.title: Twelve Years a Slave
books.author: Solomon Northup
books.summary: The account of a free black man kidnapped in 1841 and sold into slavery, from which it took twelve years to free himself.

books.title: The Lerouge Case
books.author: Émile Gaboriau
books.summary: A widow is found dead under mysterious circumstances, and Monsieur Lecoq of the police arranges to have his mentor brought in to help solve the crime.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.

books.title: The Rights of Man
books.author: Thomas Paine
books.summary: A philosopher and political activist presents a forceful argument in favor of the principles of the French Revolution and of republicanism in general, together with a condemnation of monarchy and hereditary power in general.

books.title: Songs of the Cattle Trail and Cow Camp
books.author: John A. Lomax
books.summary: A collection of cowboy poetry collected by folklorist John A. Lomax.

books.title: The Surprising Adventures of Baron Munchausen
books.author: Rudolph Erich Raspe
books.summary: The legendary Baron Munchausen’s tall tales of wonder and adventure.

books.title: Beyond Thirty
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: A young naval officer finds himself in a forbidden part of the world after storms waylay his ship.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Daphne du Maurier
books.summary: A collection of short stories by Daphne du Maurier.

books.title: A Confession
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: A brief meditation on depression, philosophy, religion, and the meaning of life.

books.title: My Four Weeks in France
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A sports columnist and humorist travels to France as a war correspondent during World War I and recounts his experiences on the assignment.
